ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Some weeks we would just have discussions about lab topics and going into lab in person was optional.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned how to properly explain my results, even if they did not turn out as expected (which they often didn't). I also learned different experiments that geneticists could use to study gene interactions and inheritance. I also learned how to make a formal lab report that was formatted similar to a research articles.
Basic lab techniques applicable to the field of genetics.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: A notable weakness of this class is that it's graded on a curve. Given the small class size (at most 15-20 people among the two sections), less than half of the students can get above a B+. This gives the class overall somewhat of a competitive nature to an extent. But in my section we often helped each other and were more collaborative.

very unorganized, not all documents were posted on canvas but rather sent over email, all assignments communicated through email, no grading on canvas, extremely difficult to keep track of responsibilities
The transparency with grading could be improved, but overall the class was very engaging, although the workload was a little much (in chunks rather than continuous).

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
No complaints. The online component was just spent going over what the lab would be and any important concepts to know. We also went over results and how to analyze them.
Having the optional in-person component was also helpful because we could interact with the material but our absence in this component was not meant to reflect on our grade. It allowed me to truly enjoy the lab component without fear of doing poorly or feeling inadequate in the class.
need to transition more to canvas in order to better the organization of the course
The effort to conduct an in person component was great, and kept the engagement high.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: If you are interested in genetics or looking for a biology lab, this is a pretty good class. It wasn't unbearable and some components were fairly interesting (speaking as a non-STEM major). The lab reports can be stressful when working through them before the deadline and it's difficult to prepare too far ahead of time for those reports (in the online version of the course).
Possibly not. If you are passionate about genetics topics then yes, but the workload may not be worth it.
